item.title: Tree on pavement between 77 dunlace road and chatsworth road has considerable hump due to tree roots above the ground level . It’s causing really hardship for elderly and disabled and pushchairs. This is fourth time council has tarmec to cover it up., 17th October
item.description:
Tree on pavement between 77 dunlace road and chatsworth road has considerable hump due to tree roots above the ground level . It’s causing really hardship for elderly and disabled and pushchairs. This is fourth time council has tarmec to cover it up.

item.title: Pigeons (20+) creating constant loud noise, filth, and laying eggs, 17th October
item.description:
20+ pigeons at 6 Broadway Market make constant LOUD noise, from before dawn, and during the day and evening. They have laid eggs in the neighbour's plant (see photo), and back decks are FILTHY with pigeon excrement. Getting worse since May.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Ada Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter build up along Millennium Way, 17th October
item.description:
Large litter build up of glass bottles, plastic bottles and food wrappers from design district to pedestrian crossing near The Pilot pub. There are no bins so O2 visitors dump everything on the footpath. The glass is a big hazard, could this be cleared
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): West Parkside, Greenwich Peninsula, London

item.category: Fly-tip Small - Less than one bag

item.title: Littering, trolleys and a safe, 17th October
item.description:
Masses of litter has built up in the short time since the last community litter pick. This includes trolleys now filled with litter as makeshift bins and litter all over both sides of the footpath from Peartree Way/Horn Lane to Charlton shopping park. There is also a dumped safe on the north side of the road, e which is an interesting one. Please please could bins be installed in this area so the community don't have to continue to clear it

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bugsby's Way, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Neighbours are just dumping all the rubbish outside of their house, 17th October
item.description:
I am writing to report an ongoing issue regarding rubbish and waste bins being left on the footpath by residents at 5 Woburn Close, SE2 8QZ. The bins and rubbish are frequently placed outside our property boundary, which is obstructing pedestrian access and creating an unsightly and unhygienic environment. We would appreciate it if this matter could be investigated and appropriate action taken to ensure that rubbish and bins are stored and collected in accordance with local regulations.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Woburn Close, London
Report on FixMyStreet
